column4: anyone knows why Ubunto 9.10 is not reading the full capacity of the HD (250 gigs) but it's only reading 40 gigs.  I cloned using Linux bootable disk clone from a 40.0 gigs.
sounds like it just made a 40g partition on the disk.
you can probably fix it with gparted, but be careful.
install gparted, it is a gui.
it's in system > administration > partition manager i think
well, that is a different program, less focused on partion editing. i forgot that they included that with 9.10
yeah, that utility doesn't resize, you need gparted for that.
it's in the system > administration menu as partition editor
nvm, it is just called gparted.
did you install gparted, or gpart? they are not the same.
.. so i'm here.  stupid question ..what's the next step ..
if this is the disk you are running the system off of, that is why you can't mess with that partition. if you want to resize you'll need to use the gparted livecd (always useful anyways)
.. u want me to pop that in ?
fire that up and you can use gparted from there to resize the partition.
you can install it if it doesn't.
